name: Yae-Arare
description: White edged Pink. Medium to large, single.

name: Yamato-Nishiki
description: White variegated Pink and Red. Medium, single with full flared stamens. Slow, compact growth. M. (For other forms of this cultivar see below and 'Ohkan' and 'Showa-no-Hikari"). See Higo.

name: Yamato-Nishiki Rose
description: Pink. (Sport of Japonica 'Yamato- Nishiki').

name: Yamaya
description: Pink tinted Purple. Medium, single.

name: Yanhong
description: Deep Red to Red (RHS 53A or 53B) with Yellow anthers and Light Yellow filaments. Small, semidouble. Average, dense growth. M. (Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' × Sasanqua Shinonome'). (China 2009 - Jian Guo Fei, Yong-hong Hu and Ya-li Zhang, Shanghai Botanical Garden of Shanghai, China). YULETIDE - Formerly Vernalis - Orange Red. Small, single. Average, upright, dense growth. E. Cold hardy. (Seedling of Sasanqua 'Hiryu'). (U.S. 1963 - Nuccio's). YULETIDE CANDLE - Formerly Vernalis - Brilliant waxy Red. Large, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Sasanqua 'Yuletide' seedling). (U.S. 2014 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL). YULETIDE SPIRIT - Formerly Vernalis - Deep Coral Red. Large, single. Dense, upright, spreading growth. (Sasanqua 'Yuletide' seedling). (U.S. 2000 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Ye Ming Zu
description: See 'Evening Glow Pearl.

name: Yeamans Hall
description: Shell Pink with Darker Pink striping. Medium, formal double. E-L. (U.S. 2006 - Sam Borom. Propagated by Coastal Carolina Camellia Society. Mt. Pleasant, SC).

name: Yellow And Purple
description: ('Yiao Huang Wei Zi' - Chinese Name'; 'Tinges of Yellow and Purple'). Light Pink with Light Purple/Lavender undertones and a small amount of Yellow at the base of the central petals. Medium, formal double with slightly waved petals. Average, open growth. [(Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' × 'Nitidissima hybrid 'Honeymoon') × Japonica Elaine's Betty']. (U.S. 2012 - John Wang, Orinda, CA).

name: Yesterday
description: Bright Pink. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis x Japonica "Tomorrow'). (England 1981 - Carlyon).

name: Yiao Huang Wei Zi
description: See 'Yellow and Purple

name: Yifen Mudan
description: See 'Spinel Pink Peony'.

name: Yingchun Hong
description: See 'Welcoming Spring Red'.

name: Yinhong Diechi
description: See 'Pink Butterfly Wing'.

name: Yipinhong
description: See 'First Class Red'.

name: Yirgella
description: White. Medium, formal double with Green leaves which are Yellow toward edge. (Foliage sport of Japonica 'Isabel"). (For another form of this cultivar see 'Geoff Hamilton'). (Aus. 1975 - S. Compton, Gosford, NSW).

name: Yobuko-Dori
description: Pale Pink. Small, single. M. (For other variations of this cultivar see 'Aka-Yobuko-Dori', 'Shiro-Yobuko-Dori'"). (Japan 1956 - Satomi).

name: Yohei-Haku
description: White to Pale Pink. Medium, semidouble to peony for to anemone form. Average, compact growth. E. (Japan 1936 - Chugai).

name: Yoi Machi
description: White margined Pink and occasionally marked Pink. Miniature, single. Average, compact, upright growth. E-M. (Oleifera 'Narumi-Gata' x Fraterna). (U.S. 1981 - Parks).

name: Yona P. Dowdle
description: Pink veined Deep Pink. Large, semidouble with very large, wavy, upright petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 1970 - C. L. Dowdle, Gulfport, MS).

name: Yosemite
description: Rose Red. Medium, semidouble. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - A. A. Baugh, Oakland, CA).

name: Yoshiaki Andoh
description: Dark Red. Medium to large, single with flared Golden stamens. Vigorous, upright, compact growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Cornelian' x Japonica 'Mrs. D. W. Davis). (U.S. 1986 - Piet and Gaeta).

name: Yoshida
description: Red. Large, single.

name: Yours Truly
description: ('Lady Vansittart Shell'). Pink streaked Deep Pink and bordered White. Medium, semidouble. (Sport of Japonica 'Lady Vansittart'). (U.S. 1949 - J. S. Tormey, Temple City, CA).

name: Youtz Wild Rose
description: Rose Pink. Medium, semidouble. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - Youtz).

name: Yudaihong
description: See 'Jade Striped Red'.

name: Yuki Oguni
description: Light Coral Pink. Small, semidouble to loose peony form. Somewhat slow, compact, spreading growth. E-M.

name: Yuki-Botan (Snowish Peony)
description: ('Pride of Descanso'). White. Large, semidouble to loose peony form with irregular petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Japan 1895 - Yokohama).

name: Yuki-Daruma
description: See 'Pax'.

name: Yuki-Fujin
description: Light Pink. Miniature, single.

name: Yuki-Geshiki
description: Blush Pink with Creamy petaloids. Small to medium, anemone to peony form.

name: Yuki-Komachi
description: Light Pink. Miniature, peony.

name: Yuki-Shiro
description: White. Medium, single.

name: Yuki-Sugata
description: White. Medium, single. See Higo.

name: Yukimi-Guruma (Snow-Viewing Carriage)
description: White with Golden anthers and Light Yellow filaments. Large, single. Upright growth. M. (Japan 1859).

name: Yulan Cha
description: See 'Magnolia Camellia'.

name: Yulan's Summer Dream
description: ('Xiameng Yulan' - Chinese Name). Bright Red with Yellow anthers and Milk-White filaments. Medium, single form. Vigorous, upright, dense growth. Summer-Winter - Continuous. (Japonica 'Miyakodori' × C. azalea). (U.S. 2021 - Palm Landscape Architecture Co. Ltd., Guangzhou, Guangdong, China).

name: Yume (Dream)
description: Pink blotched White (genetic variegation). Small, single. Average, loose upright growth. M-L. (Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira' x Yuhsienensis). (Japan. 1992 - Kaoru Hagiya, Niigata).

name: Yumeji
description: Pink. Large, peony form.

name: Yummy Fragrance
description: Bright Red. Medium, peony form. Average, upright growth. E-L. Fragrant. Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' × (Hybrid 'Salab' seedling x Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'). (N.Z. 1994 - J. Finlay).

name: Yupan Jinhua
description: See 'Jinhua's Jade Tray'.

name: Yuri-Shibhori (Lily Variegated)
description: White with Crimson stripes with Golden anthers and White filaments. Small, single. (Japan 1976 - Kan Utsugi, Osaka).

name: Yuyake-Fuji
description: Deep Pink veined deeper, fading to White margins. Small, single - 5-6 petals. (Sport of Japonica 'Yuri-shibori). (Japan 1988).

name: Yvonne Amizonica
description: Dark Ruby Red. Large, semidouble to peony form. Average, dense, spreading growth. E-L. (Reticulata seedling). (N.Z. 1991 - H. Burwell, Inglewood).

name: Yvonne Marie
description: White. Very large, peony form. Slow, spreading growth. M-L. (Saluenensis × Japonica). (N.Z. 1984 - Mrs. J. E. Shaw, Wairua).

name: Yvonne Rolfe
description: Light Crimson Pink. Very large, loose peony form. Open, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Arch of Triumph' seedling). (Aus. 1983 - B. Hooper, Bexley North, NSW).

name: Yvonne Tyson
description: Phlox Pink with Salmon undertone. Medium, anemone form. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - W. V. Tyson, Savannah, GA).

name: Yvonne Tyson Variegated
description: Phlox Pink and White variation of 'Yvonne Tyson'.
